breakthroughPP.players

Class Probabilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • breakthroughPP.players.Probabilities
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Setting

    public class Probabilities
extends java.lang.Object
implements Setting
    This class provides a double[][] matrix containing a value for each field on the board. This value indicates the ranking of the field, the higher it is, the more desireable it is for the player to move to.
    Author:
    Fabiola Buschendorf

    • Method Detail

      • getProbabilities

        public double[][] getProbabilities()

      • getProbabilitie

        public double getProbabilitie(int number,
                     int letter)

      • initProbabilities

        private void initProbabilities()
        initialises the probability values for the board. Initialized value is 1.0, additionally +0.1 the nearer the oppontent's boarder is.

      • updateProbabilities

        public void updateProbabilities()
        Calculates the ranking-value of each field on the board with current status. Several factors contribute to the value of a field: - distance to oppontents side - predator density -...

      • numberInBoundaries

        private boolean numberInBoundaries(int number,
                         int color)
        Checks if the opponent side is examined
        Parameters:
        number - the current examined field number
        color - the color of current player defined in Setting.
        Returns:
        boolean, if the number boundary (y-axis) was reached.

      • leftBorder

        private boolean leftBorder(int letter)
        Checks if we examine a field at the left border
        Parameters:
        letter - x position which is checked to be one at the left margin
        Returns:
        boolean whether the token is at the left border.

      • rightBorder

        private boolean rightBorder(int letter)
        Checks if we examine a field at the right border
        Parameters:
        letter - y position which is checked to be one at the right margin
        Returns:
        boolean whether the token is at the right border.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        main for testing purposes
